700931f-a.text:
East Tremont Ave., north side, between Unionport Road and Hoguet Ave. (vantage-point). The view is northeastward across the car yard and repair shops of the New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad. In the right background is discernible the Club House of the Morris Park Race Track.

About 1910.
700931f-a.folder: Tremont Avenue (East & Unionport Road, Bronx, NY

701932f-c.text:
(1)
Unionport Road, south from near E. Tremont Avenue, showing. on the east side of the thoroughfare, the New York Catholic protectory shortly prior to demolition. On the site will be erected the huge housing project to be constructed by the
Metropolitan Life Insurance Company.
April 10, 1938
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the Catholic Protectory buildings as seen from White Plains Road, near E. Tremont Avenue.
April 10, 1938
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A view of the Protectory's high wall enclosure, on the east side of Unionport Road, as seen from Virginia Avenue. In the background is the Protectory's church.
April 13, 1938
P. L. Sperr

700930f-a.text:
Charred freight station, E. Tremont Ave., east of
Unionport Rd., Bronx.
Sept. 4, 1939
P.L. Sperr, photographer
700930f-a.folder: Tremont Avenue (East & Unionport Road, Bronx, NY

701571f-a.text:
The Parkchester Houses Development, taken at the site of Unionport Road, from East Tremont Avenue, Bronx.
P. L. Sperr, photographer
Sept. 4, 1939
701571f-a.folder: Unionport Road & Tremont Avenue (East), Bronx, NY

701933f-b.text:
(1)
Unionport Road (vantage-point), east side, between East Tremont Ave. and Baker Ave., showing the storage yard of the Starck-Rawlings Company. The point of vantage is the bridge over the tracks of the
New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad.
July 18, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view of the Starck-Rawlings yard from a different angle.
July 18, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
